footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.81:1) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The sun and the moon will be folded up (or joined together or deprived of their lights) on the Day of Resurrection." [See the Qur’ân (V.75:9)] (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.4, Hadith No.422).

translations.english_saheeh: When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness]
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. When the sun is wound round and its light is lost and is overthrown.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: When the sun is wrapped up in darkness,

translations.english_saheeh: And when the stars fall, dispersing,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the stars fall.
translations.english_rwwad: and when the stars are scattered,

translations.english_saheeh: And when the mountains are removed
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the mountains are made to pass away;
translations.english_rwwad: and when the mountains are vanished,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1865]- Those ten months pregnant and nearing delivery. This verse alludes to distraction from the most valued of possessions.

translations.english_saheeh: And when full-term she-camels[1865] are neglected
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the pregnant she-camels are neglected;
translations.english_rwwad: and when pregnant camels are left unattended,

translations.english_saheeh: And when the wild beasts are gathered
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the wild beasts are gathered together.
translations.english_rwwad: and when wild beasts are gathered,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1866]- Or "when the seas have overflowed [into each other]."

translations.english_saheeh: And when the seas are filled with flame[1866]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the seas become as blazing Fire or overflow.
translations.english_rwwad: and when the seas are set on fire,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1867]- With another like soul. It can also mean "joined" (with their groups or sects) .

translations.english_saheeh: And when the souls are paired[1867]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the souls are joined with their bodies, (the good with the good and the bad with the bad).
translations.english_rwwad: and when the souls are sorted,

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.81:8) Narrated Al-Mughîrah bin Shu‘bah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Allâh has forbidden for you: (1) to be undutiful to your mothers, (2) to bury your daughters alive, (3) not to pay the rights of the others (e.g., charity), and (4) to beg of men (i.e., begging). And Allâh hates for you: (1) sinful and useless talk like backbiting, or that you talk too much about others, (2) to ask too many questions (in disputed religious matters), and (3) to waste the wealth (by extravagance with lack of wisdom and thinking)." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.3, Hadith No.591).

translations.english_saheeh: And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the female (infant) buried alive (as the pagan Arabs used to do) is questioned:[2]
translations.english_rwwad: and when the baby girl buried alive is asked,

translations.english_saheeh: For what sin she was killed
translations.english_hilali_khan: For what sin, was she killed?
translations.english_rwwad: for what crime she was killed,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1868]- On which are recorded the deeds of all people.

translations.english_saheeh: And when the pages[1868] are spread [i.e., made public]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the (written) pages [of deeds (good and bad) of every person] are laid open.
translations.english_rwwad: and when records of deeds are spread open,

translations.english_saheeh: And when the sky is stripped away
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the heaven is stripped off and taken away from its place;
translations.english_rwwad: and when the sky is stripped away,

translations.english_saheeh: And when Hellfire is set ablaze
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when Hell-fire is set ablaze.
translations.english_rwwad: and when the Blazing Fire is flared up,

translations.english_saheeh: And when Paradise is brought near,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when Paradise is brought near.
translations.english_rwwad: and when Paradise is brought near –

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1869]- i.e., all of one's deeds from worldly life, which have accompanied the soul to the Hereafter.

translations.english_saheeh: A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].[1869]
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Then) every person will know what he has brought (of good and evil).
translations.english_rwwad: then every soul will know what it has brought about.

translations.english_saheeh: So I swear by the retreating stars -
translations.english_hilali_khan: So verily, I swear by the planets that recede (i.e. disappear during the day and appear during the night).
translations.english_rwwad: I swear by the receding stars,

translations.english_saheeh: Those that run [their courses] and disappear [i.e., set]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the planets that move swiftly and hide themselves.
translations.english_rwwad: that rise and hide,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1870]- An alternative meaning is "as it departs."

translations.english_saheeh: And by the night as it closes in[1870]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the night as it departs.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the night as it departs,

translations.english_saheeh: And by the dawn when it breathes [i.e., stirs]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the dawn as it brightens.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the day as it breaks –

translations.english_saheeh: [That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a word [conveyed by] a noble messenger [i.e., Gabriel]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, this is the Word (this Qur’ân brought by) a most honourable messenger [Jibrîl (Gabrîl), from Allâh to Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم].
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, this [Qur’an] is a word conveyed by a noble angel-messenger.

arabic_text: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِي ٱلۡعَرۡشِ مَكِينٖ

translations.english_saheeh: [Who is] possessed of power and with the Owner of the Throne, secure [in position],
translations.english_hilali_khan: Owner of power, (and high rank) with (Allâh), the Lord of the Throne,
translations.english_rwwad: extremely powerful, highly revered with the Lord of the Throne,

translations.english_saheeh: Obeyed there [in the heavens] and trustworthy.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Obeyed (by the angels in the heavens), and trustworthy.
translations.english_rwwad: obeyed [by other angels] and moreover, trustworthy.

translations.english_saheeh: And your companion [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) ] is not [at all] mad.[1871]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (O people) your companion (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is not a madman.
translations.english_rwwad: Your fellow [the Prophet] is not madman.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1872]- i.e., the eastern horizon, where the sun rises. See footnote to 53:6

translations.english_saheeh: And he has already seen him [i.e., Gabriel] in the clear horizon.[1872]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) saw him [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] in the clear horizon (towards the east).
translations.english_rwwad: He indeed saw him [Gabriel] on the clear horizon.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1873]- Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) did not withhold that knowledge of the unseen which Allāh had revealed to him in the Qur’ān.

translations.english_saheeh: And he [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] is not a withholder of [knowledge of] the unseen.[1873]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) withholds not a knowledge of the Unseen.
translations.english_rwwad: He does not withhold [knowledge of] the unseen.

phonetic: 81.25 Wa Mā Huwa Biqawli Shayţānin Rajīmin

translations.english_saheeh: And it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And it (the Qur’ân) is not the word of the outcast Shaitân (Satan).
translations.english_rwwad: This [Qur’an] is not the word of an accursed devil.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1874]- In your denial of the Qur’ān and in your accusations against the Prophet (ﷺ) . The meaning is essentially "Surely, you have strayed far from Allāh's path."

translations.english_saheeh: So where are you going?[1874]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then where are you going?
translations.english_rwwad: So which way are you going?

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.81:27)
a) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "There was no Prophet among the Prophets but was given miracles because of which people had security or had belief, but what I have been given is the Divine Revelation which Allâh has revealed to me. So I hope that my followers will be more than those of any other Prophet on the Day of Resurrection." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.9, Hadith No.379)
b) It is obligatory to have Belief in the Messengership of the Prophet (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم).
Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "By Him (Allâh) in Whose Hand Muhammad’s soul is, there is none from amongst the Jews and Christians (of these present nations) who hears about me and then dies without believing in the Message with which I have been sent (i.e. Islâmic Monotheism), but he will be from the dwellers of the (Hell) Fire." (Sahih Muslim , the Book of Faith, Vol.1, Chapter No.240). See also (V.3:85) and (V.3:116).

translations.english_saheeh: It is not except a reminder to the worlds
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, this (the Qur’ân) is no less than a Reminder to (all) the ‘Âlamîn (mankind and jinn)[3]
translations.english_rwwad: It is but a reminder to the worlds,

translations.english_saheeh: For whoever wills among you to take a right course.
translations.english_hilali_khan: To whomsoever among you who wills to walk straight.
translations.english_rwwad: for those among you who wish to take the straight path.

arabic_text: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
phonetic: 81.29 Wa Mā Tashā'ūna 'Illā 'An Yashā'a Allāhu Rabbu Al-`Ālamīna

translations.english_saheeh: And you do not will except that Allāh wills - Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And you cannot will unless (it be) that Allâh wills - the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: But you cannot wish except by the Will of Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
